posts.author: scoobytoobins
posts.post_text: October 22, 2019 at 2:55 AM#2you could do something like:setvar $loopcmd = 1---whatever your macro line is---addvar $loopcmd = 1[$loopcmd<x] macro 1.macronumber.line (---whatever your macro line is---) where x is the amount of times you want to loop

posts.post_text: October 22, 2019 at 10:01 PM#3macro "loop"1. setvar $count 12. setvar $end x3. your commands4. ...9. addvar $count 110. [$count<=$end] macro 1."loop".3Refer to "square brackets" help.if you do [$loopcmd<x], you'll miss the last step.
